result.execSummary:
The defendant Korea K Beck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for -2- days, if revoked.
12/5/2017 - Court approves Substance Abuse Program for defendant.
Concurrent with: 14CF127

miscConds.notes: Restitution due during term of probation. The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Court costs due during probation term. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

-Counseling as deemed appropriate.
-Maintain employment of at least 24 hours per week.
-Pay supervision fees.

Notice of Hearing-Sentencing hearing: Korea K Beck   NO NEW ADDRESS FOUND
Sentencing hearing on April 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.

State by ADA Jeffrey Sisley.  Defendant in person and by Atty Dejunco.  Counsel files plea questionnaire on this case and 14CF127.  State moves to dismiss but read-in count 2; Court so grants.  State recommends on Ct 1:  A prison sentence, but will not suggest a length of time.  Defense is free to argue.  Court examines defendant.  Defendant changes plea to no contest.  Court accepts change of plea & finds defendant guilty.  Court orders presentence investigation and orders matter adj for sentencing on 4/6 at 11 am.
